section.name: Configuring JSpider
section.p: JSpider is higly flexible and adaptable, which requires a lot of configuration. This section is a reference for every piece of configuration that can be done with JSpider.

subsection.name: Environment Configuration
subsection.p: This type of configuration is used to tell JSpider in what type of environment (network,...) it is operating, and how it should handle this. This type of configuration is done in the 'jspider.properties' file, which can be found under the /conf/{yourconfig} folder

tr.td: How to configure JSpider to use a proxy server to reach some destination hosts.

subsection.name: Per-site Configuration
subsection.p: This type of configuration is done on a per-site basis. Under the /conf subdirectory, you'll find different properties files for different configurations.
The sites.properties file contains the reference towards these configurations.

tr.td: Reference for the configuration of sites.properties, the configuration file that assigns a specific per-site configuration to a website.
Explains how to create a specific configuration for a certain site.
